parts: what are the requirements to study pharmacy in gauteng universities

To study Pharmacy, specifically at USIU-Africa, you'll need to meet certain requirements [6].

*   **KCSE**: A minimum mean grade of C+ (plus).
*   **Programme-Specific Requirements**: Bachelor of Pharmacy requires a KCSE B- with C+ in the science cluster [6].

Best TVET Colleges in South Africa for Engineering Studies - Course Match,

Baccalaureate (IB) diploma are also accepted. 71 ● Additional Selection Elements: Admission to Strathmore is a multi-stage process: 1. Entrance Examination: All qualified applicants must sit for and achieve a distinction in the university's entrance examination, which tests both English and Mathematics proficiency. 69 2. Oral Interview: A successful performance in the written exam is followed by an oral interview to assess the candidate's suitability, communication skills, and alignment with the university's values. 71 3. Holistic Review: The university explicitly states that proven leadership skills and outstanding performance in extracurricular activities are an added advantage, indicating a holistic review process. 70 ● Application Process: Candidates must book an interview and attend with original and copies of academic certificates, passport photos, a copy of their birth certificate or National ID, and an entrance exam fee of KES 1,800 to KES 2,000 depending on the programme. 70 3.2 United States International University-Africa (USIU-Africa) USIU-Africa operates on an American curriculum model and is accredited by both CUE in Kenya and the WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC) in the USA. This dual accreditation makes it attractive to students seeking global mobility. ● Academic Requirements: USIU-Africa accepts a wide range of qualifications 74 : ○ KCSE: A minimum mean grade of C+ (plus). ○ GCE/IGCSE/IB: 5 upper-level passes at O-Level and 3 principal passes at A-Level, or an IB Diploma with five passes of grade 4 or higher. ○ US High School Diploma: A GPA of 2.50 or higher. ● Programme-Specific Requirements: Certain programmes have stricter prerequisites. For example, the Bachelor of Pharmacy requires a KCSE B- with C+ in the science cluster, while BSc in Epidemiology & Biostatistics requires a C+ overall with specific grades of Biology C+, Mathematics B-, and English B. 74 ● Language Requirements: All applicants from non-English speaking countries must demonstrate proficiency through a TOEFL score of at least 79 (iBT) or an IELTS score of 7.0 or better. 74 ● Transfer Students: USIU-Africa has a well-defined policy for transfer students from other accredited institutions, accepting up to 90 trimester units of credit for courses where a grade of C or better was earned. 74 3.3 Daystar University As a prominent faith-based institution, Daystar University emphasizes an education grounded in Christian values alongside academic excellence. ● Academic Requirements: The general entry requirement for undergraduate programmes is a KCSE mean grade of C+ or at least 4 credits in IGCSE with 2 credit passes at A-Level/GCE. 76 ● Programme-Specific Requirements: ○ BA in Communication: Requires a minimum of C+ in English. Students with C+ or below in English must take a remedial English course (ENG 098). 76 ○ BSc in Applied Computer Science: Requires a minimum of C+ in both Mathematics and Physics. 76 ○ BSc Nursing: Requires a C+ in Mathematics or Physics, Biological Sciences, and English. 76 ● Additional

or Kiswahili. 82 ○ BSc Computer Science: Requires a KCSE C+ with a minimum of C+ in Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry/Physical Science. 83 ○ Bachelor of Film and Animation: Requires a KCSE C+ with a minimum of C+ in English/Kiswahili. 84 ● Alternative Pathways: The university accepts relevant Higher National Diplomas or Diplomas from KNEC or other recognized institutions, often with specific KCSE subject grade prerequisites. 82 3.7 Zetech University Zetech University focuses on career-oriented programmes, particularly in technology and business, with clear and specific admission criteria. ● General Requirements: The minimum entry requirement for a bachelor's degree is a KCSE mean grade of C+. 85 ● Programme-Specific Requirements: ○ BSc in Software Engineering: Requires a KCSE C+ and a minimum of C (plain) in Mathematics. 87 ○ BSc in Information Technology: Requires a KCSE C+ and a minimum of C (plain) in Mathematics, English, and Kiswahili. 88 ○ Bachelor of Education (Arts): Requires a KCSE C+ with C+ in two teaching subjects. Those wishing to take Business Studies must have a C+ in Mathematics. 85 ● Alternative Pathways: Zetech accepts relevant KNEC diplomas or other diplomas from recognized institutions, often with specific minimum grades in English and Mathematics. 85 3.8 Riara University Riara University emphasizes a holistic educational experience and has specific, often higher, entry requirements for its flagship programmes. ● General Requirements: A KCSE mean grade of C+ is the general minimum, but specific programmes have higher thresholds. 89 ● Programme-Specific Requirements: ○ Bachelor of Laws (LLB): Requires a mean grade of C+ and above with a B (plain) in English or Kiswahili. Admission also involves an oral interview to establish suitability. 89 ○ BSc in Computer Science: Requires a C+ mean grade with C+ in Mathematics and Physics. 89 ○ Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA): Requires a C+ mean grade with C (plain) in English and Mathematics. 89 ● Alternative Pathways: The university accepts relevant diplomas with a credit pass and A-Level qualifications. 89 3.9 Pan Africa Christian (PAC) University PAC University is a faith-based institution committed to developing servant-leaders. ● General Requirements: The minimum entry requirement for undergraduate degrees is a KCSE mean grade of C+ or its equivalent. 90 ● Alternative Pathways: PAC University accepts applicants with a C (plain) who have completed a Pre-University Certificate, or those with a relevant Diploma from a recognized institution. 90 For the Bachelor of Commerce, KACE with two principal passes or a relevant professional certificate is also accepted. 91 ● Application Process: Applications are made online, requiring a passport photo, scanned ID/Passport, academic certificates, and a non-refundable application fee of KES 2,500. 92 3.10 Kenya Methodist University (KeMU) KeMU offers a variety of programmes with multiple intakes throughout the year (January, May, September). 93 ● General Requirements: The minimum requirement for undergraduate programmes is
